ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the history of AFAM, both at Yale and beyond; the methodologies rooted in the discipline and the ones that we identify at the heart of its future; and the scholarship of Yale AFAM professors specifically.

AFAM 410 helped me to think critically about the active nature of black studies -- what does it mean not just to study black history but to actively engage with the black present and intentionally imagine black futures?

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course this year was AMAZING. I thoroughly enjoyed all of the assignments and felt that they were in line with what each of us found most useful both for rounding out our approach to the discipline and situating ourselves for our senior essays. A huge strength was the intimate size of our cohort which allowed the class to be informed by each of our interests and to foster closeness between all of us which facilitated deep engagement in discussion.

I thought AFAM 410 was wonderfully structured, though I believe it could have benefited from perhaps meeting twice a week in shorter blocks, rather than once a week, simply because there was always so much to discuss!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend AFAM 410 to other AFAM majors looking to learn meaningfully in community with one another and think critically about the future of black American life.
